newsitem.title: UK: UK's Bardon and Camas to merge.
newsitem.headline: UK's Bardon and Camas to merge.

text.p: British-based building materials companies Bardon Group Plc and Camas Plc said on Monday they planned to merge to form a new group to be called Aggregate Industries.

Camas shareholders will own 52 percent of the new company and will receive two new Bardon shares for each Camas share, the companies said in a joint statement. The new company would have had combined sales of 656 million pounds ($1.1 billion) if it had been in place in 1996.
The companies said the all-share deal would create a substantial UK/U.S. aggregates group with combined reserves of 2.2 billion tonnes as at December 31, 1996.

They said rationalisation was expected to produce cost savings of at least 10 million pounds a year, and promised "further operational synergies over the medium term" would add significantly to shareholder value.
Maurice Warren of Camas will be chairman of Aggregate Industries and Bardon's Peter Tom will be chief executive, with the new board comprising a balance of Bardon and CAMAS directors.
Maurice Warren said, "This merger represents an outstanding opportunity to bring together two focused, aggregates businesses operating in similar markets. The commercial rationale is compelling."

Peter Tom said, "The operational benefits and opportunities from the merger are expected to be substantial. Aggregate Industries will have a strong capital structure, a substantial consented reserve base and an experienced management team from which to deliver long term value to shareholders." ($ = 0.614 British Pounds)
